fact_list.fact_text: Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must take special care to watch out for warnings about work activity and obstructions ahead.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must be alert to the traffic situation around them.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must observe orange warning and information signs that provide help.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must not exceed any temporary maximum speed limit posted at the work zone for their safety.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must get into the correct lane in good time.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must not switch lanes to overtake queuing traffic or move through areas marked off by traffic cones or barriers.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must be cautious not to get into the path of traffic entering or leaving the work area.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must avoid being distracted by activities in the work area.
Motorists, motorcyclists, or cyclists must concentrate on the road ahead and maintain a safe distance from traffic in front.
Pedestrians must keep away from the work area.
Pedestrians must not enter the work area for convenience or as a shortcut.
Pedestrians must follow the directional signs for alternative paths when the footpath is blocked.
Pedestrians must not walk along the traffic lane if it is not designated and cordoned off for pedestrians.
Work zone signs are displayed along the section of the road affected by work activity where temporary traffic control is exercised.
Work zone signs contain a black symbol or message with or without a logo on an orange background, and they are either diamond-shaped for warning or rectangular-shaped for information.
Lateral shift markers are work zone signs indicating a lateral change in direction of the carriageway or a sharp bend in a road diversion through the work zone.
